page.title: 10Flooding in Cornholme
page.content: In 1982 there was a bad flood which was the result of a long dry spell of weather followed by a short torrential downpour. Due to the nature of the terrain the water cascades down the hillsides in various streams and in order to utilise the narrow valley bottom the streams are then led into a culvert and very often houses and factories are built over the culvert. Over a period of time stones have been carried down the hillsides and eventually the culvert was restricted unbeknown to anyone. Even though the area has had a history of flooding no-one accepted responsibility for checking the culvert and as a result it was unable to cope with the sudden influx of water and Burnley Road was flooded to a considerable depth and left a trail of destruction.
